job.title: Senior Data Scientist, Analytics
job.description: <p><strong>This position is open to remote applicants.</strong></p><p><br></p><p>WHAT YOU WILL DO</p><p>· Wrangle and analyze large data sets from multiple data sources, including our internal data mesh, third party vendors, and customer feeds</p><p>· Provide insights to help business, product, and engineering leaders understand customer needs, trends in malware and malicious/anomalous behaviors, and user and system behaviors</p><p>· Find actionable strategic insights in the data, create reports and presentations to summarize findings, and partner with product managers and executives to inform and influence strategic decisions</p><p>· Work with product and expert teams to define and evaluate key product metrics</p><p>· Build, operationalize, and automate analytics assessments and reports using SQL and Python within a cloud-based infrastructure</p><p>· Act as a leader across analytics efforts in BB’s cybersecurity division, fostering best practices for analytics and data (efficiency, robustness, integrity, quality, standardization, automation, etc) across all internal analytics, engineering, and product teams</p><p><br></p><p>QUALIFICATIONS</p><p>· Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field</p><p>-7 years of experience with a Bachelor or 5+ years with a Masters, of experience in data analytics or related quantitative role (2+ years with a PhD)</p><p>· Expertise in SQL and development experience with Python</p><p>· Experience working with large data sets using distributed computing tools (Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc) in a cloud environment</p><p>· Deep understanding of statistical methods and applications (hypothesis testing, probability, regression, experimentation)</p><p>· Great verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate the results of analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences</p><p>· Strong skills in problem solving, organization, and critical thinking</p><p><br></p><p>ABOVE AND BEYOND</p><p>· Doctorate in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field</p><p>· Experience employing machine learning algorithms (e.g., time series, clustering, anomaly detection, etc) on real world problems</p><p>· Mentoring experience within an analytical environment</p><p>· Experience in cybersecurity</p>
